content: A single row search bar would be small for using search pills. Search bar in the current implementation also becomes very small after clicking 1 term. What should be our design approach for mobile devices?

@Shubham Padia we're not too focused on the mobile web user experience for search so I think we can defer this for now, but it probably makes sense to have search selection be a bit of a full-screen experience like the emoji picker.
Okay. Just to be clear, we should disable the search bar for mobile users right now ?
No, I would just leave it a little janky and make a note to deal with this in a follow-up issue.
We have plans to adjust the center-top area design more significantly once the pills are in, and we can just include the mobile design as part of that effort.
I just think we should try to figure out a way to make that issue out-of-scope to avoid your project becoming too complex.
Cool, I'll make some minor css changes then for the mobile version enough to make it not look bad/out of place.
